result.execSummary:
The defendant Alyssa Marie Munoz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during term of probation. Any cash bail posted on this case to be applied to costs and surcharges owed. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

No contact with the victim without the approval of the court.

Successfully complete a BIP training program or the program offered by La Luz Del Mundo Family Services.
Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation.
Attend and successfully complete a Parenting class.

AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Absolute sobriety.
Random screens.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Alyssa Marie Munoz in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Probation Memorandum received and filed.  Probation agent present in court.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered the time in the House of Correction, previously ordered and STAYED  for review on today's date, be STAYED until the termination of probation or for future use at the agent's discretion.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 10-09-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Alyssa Marie Munoz in court with Attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Micha Schwab, student intern practicing under the supervision of Sarra Mae Kiaie, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

As to Count 2:
Court ordered defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; credit for Zero days served.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for  18 MONTHS with the following conditions:
NOTE:  Probation sentence can be served in Racine County.

- Court ordered 30 days in the House of Correction; stayed for the use at the discretion of the probation department.
- Successfully complete a BIP training program or the program offered by La Luz Del Mundo Family Services
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation
- Attend and successfully complete a Parenting class
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Absolute Sobriety
- Random screens
- No contact with the victim without the approval of the court.
- Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)
- 3rd party contact for the purpose of child custody/visitation
- Seek/maintain employment.
- Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation.  Any cash bail posted on this case to be applied to costs and surcharges owed.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment
- No contact with firearms
- Attend the probation review hearing on 10-09-2015

Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Alyssa Marie Munoz in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #1, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT #2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-30-2015 at 8:30 am.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-30-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Alyssa Marie Munoz in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-28-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.    mld
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 05-05-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Alyssa Marie Munoz
Current: 2332 Howe Street, Mount Pleasant, WI 53403   (Effective: 04-20-2015)
Prior: 2332 Howe Street, Mount Pleasant, WI 53403

As an additional condition of bail:
Court MODIFIES No Contact Order.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Karus C.   AND/OR  their place of residence   AND/OR their place of employment

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Alyssa Marie Munoz in court.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-076

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.  Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 4.
Clerk:  jms
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 04-20-2015 at 01:30pm
